passage:
(1) DNA, which stands for deoxyribonucleic acid, is often referred to as the blueprint of life because it contains the instructions that all living organisms need to develop, function, and reproduce. Found in nearly every cell of every organism, DNA is a complex molecule that carries genetic information from one generation to the next. Its unique structure, resembling a twisted ladder or double helix, allows it to store vast amounts of information in a small space.

(2) The primary role of DNA is to store information in the form of genes. Genes are specific sequences of DNA that provide instructions for making proteins, which are essential for carrying out most cellular functions. Just as letters form words in a language, the four chemical bases of DNA—adenine, thymine, guanine, and cytosine—form a genetic code that cells can read. This code determines everything from eye color to how efficiently our bodies process certain nutrients.

(3) DNA also plays a crucial role in cell division and reproduction. Before a cell divides, it must replicate its DNA so that each new cell receives a complete set of genetic instructions. This process ensures that genetic information is passed accurately from parent cells to daughter cells. In sexual reproduction, DNA from both parents combines to create offspring with unique genetic characteristics, contributing to the diversity of life on Earth.

(4) Furthermore, DNA is involved in the body's response to environmental changes. Through a process called gene expression, cells can turn specific genes on or off in response to changes in their environment. This allows organisms to adapt to new conditions without changing their underlying genetic code. For example, exposure to sunlight can trigger cells to produce more melanin, the pigment that darkens skin, providing protection against harmful ultraviolet rays.

(5) Understanding DNA has revolutionized many fields, from medicine to agriculture. Scientists can now identify genetic disorders, develop targeted treatments, and even modify the DNA of plants to increase crop yields or resistance to disease. As research continues, our knowledge of how DNA functions in living organisms expands, opening new possibilities for improving health and addressing global challenges like food security and disease prevention.

questions.question: Which form of the verb is correct? She _____ for the bus when it started to rain.
Choose the correct tense. By next month, I _____ in this apartment for five years.
Select the correct option. If it _____ tomorrow, we will cancel the picnic.
Which sentence is grammatically correct?

options.A: Neither of the students have completed the assignment.
options.B: Neither of the students has completed the assignment.
options.C: Neither of the student has completed the assignment.
options.D: Neither the students have completed the assignment.

questions.question: Select the correct relative pronoun. The book _____ you recommended was very interesting.
Choose the correct option. You _____ eat in the library; it's against the rules.
Select the correct preposition. The meeting will be held _____ Tuesday morning.
Which sentence uses the comparative form correctly?

options.A: This building is more taller than the one next to it.
options.B: This building is the tallest than the one next to it.
options.C: This building is taller than the one next to it.
options.D: This building is more taller of the one next to it.

questions.question: Choose the correct form. They _____ the project by the end of last week.
Select the correct article. I saw _____ interesting movie last night.
Which sentence is in the passive voice?

options.C: In 1980, they were building this house.

questions.question: Choose the correct conjunction. I wanted to go to the party, _____ I had too much work to do.
Select the correct question tag. You like coffee, _____?
Which sentence uses the modal verb correctly?

options.A: You must to arrive before 9 PM.
options.C: You might to arrive before 9 PM.

questions.question: Choose the correct form. If I _____ rich, I would travel around the world.
Complete the sentence with the correct phrase. The new policy aims _____ reducing waste in the office.
Choose the correct phrasal verb. Could you please _____ the volume? I can't hear the TV.
Select the correct idiom. After winning the lottery, John was on cloud _____.

Select the correct word to complete this common expression. It's raining _____ and dogs.
Choose the most appropriate response. 'Would you like some coffee?' '_____'
Select the correct word order. 'She _____ to the store yesterday.'
Choose the correct form to complete the sentence. '_____ dinner, we watched a movie.'
Which phrase best completes the sentence? 'She tried to _____ the ladder against the wall.'
Choose the correct meaning of 'prevent' in this sentence: 'The new security system will prevent unauthorized access.'
Which sentence uses 'encourage' correctly?

options.A: Her parents encourage to study medicine.
options.B: Her parents encourage her studying medicine.
options.C: Her parents encourage her to study medicine.
options.D: Her parents encourage her for studying medicine.

questions.question: Select the correct phrase with 'enjoy':

options.A: I enjoy to swim in the ocean.
options.B: I enjoy swimming in the ocean.
options.C: I enjoy for swimming in the ocean.
options.D: I enjoy with swimming in the ocean.

questions.question: Which sentence uses 'refer' correctly?

options.A: He referred the book to his friend.
options.B: He referred to the book in his essay.
options.C: He referred at the book during his speech.
options.D: He referred with the book when explaining.

questions.question: Choose the correct form of 'create' in this sentence: 'The artist _____ a beautiful sculpture last year.'
Select the correct meaning of 'guess' in this context: 'I can only guess what happened at the meeting.'
Which phrase correctly uses 'improve'?

options.A: She wants to improve on her English.
options.B: She wants to improve in her English.
options.C: She wants to improve her English.
options.D: She wants to improve by her English.

questions.question: Choose the correct meaning of 'order' in this sentence: 'Please place your order before noon.'
Select the correct definition of 'reason' as used in this sentence: 'What was your reason for leaving early?'

options.A: She persuaded him buying the car.
options.B: She persuaded him to buy the car.
options.C: She persuaded him for buying the car.
options.D: She persuaded him about to buy the car.

questions.question: Choose the correct form of 'mention' in this sentence: 'He _____ the problem during the meeting yesterday.'
Select the correct use of 'control' in this context: 'The pilot struggled to _____ the aircraft during the storm.'
Which phrase correctly uses 'weigh'?

options.A: The package weighs closely to 5 kilograms.
options.C: The package weighs about to 5 kilograms.
options.D: The package weighs nearly for 5 kilograms.

questions.question: Choose the correct form of 'decrease' in this sentence: 'The number of visitors has _____ over the past year.'
According to the passage, what is DNA often referred to as?
What is the primary role of DNA according to paragraph 2?

options.B: To store information in the form of genes

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as one of the four chemical bases of DNA?
According to paragraph 3, why must DNA be replicated before cell division?

options.C: To ensure each new cell receives complete genetic instructions

questions.question: What is gene expression according to the passage?

options.A: The process of creating new genes
options.B: The process of turning specific genes on or off

questions.question: What example does the passage give of the body's response to environmental changes?

options.A: Production of antibodies when exposed to viruses
options.B: Increased production of melanin when exposed to sunlight
options.C: Changes in DNA structure due to pollution
options.D: Modification of genes due to diet

questions.question: According to paragraph 5, understanding DNA has revolutionized which fields?
What can scientists do with DNA according to the final paragraph?

options.C: Modify plant DNA to increase crop yields

questions.question: The passage suggests that DNA is important for addressing which global challenges?
Which statement best describes the structure of DNA as mentioned in the passage?

options.A: A single helix resembling a spiral staircase
options.B: A twisted ladder or double helix
options.C: A circular molecule with four sections
options.D: A complex network of interwoven strands
